intro: Malvastrum stuebelii, commonly known as the desert mallow, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its woolly, silver-green foliage and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has a robust root system that allows it to thrive in poor, sandy soils and withstand drought conditions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Malvastrum stuebelii is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and dry streambeds.
